title: hipages Group Holdings Full Year 2025 Earnings: EPS: AU$0.018 (vs AU$0.027 in FY 2024)
description: hipages Group Holdings ( ASX:HPG ) Full Year 2025 Results Key Financial Results Revenue: AU$83.2m (up 9.2% from FY...
content:
• Profit margin: 2.9% (down from 4.7% in FY 2024). The decrease in margin was driven by higher expenses.
• EPS: AU$0.018 (down from AU$0.027 in FY 2024).

We've found 21 US stocks that are forecast to pay a dividend yield of over 6% next year. See the full list for free.

All figures shown in the chart above are for the trailing 12 month (TTM) period

Looking ahead, revenue is forecast to grow 9.8% p.a. on average during the next 3 years, compared to a 8.0% growth forecast for the Interactive Media and Services industry in Australia.

Performance of the Australian Interactive Media and Services industry.

The company's shares are up 26% from a week ago.

It's still necessary to consider the ever-present spectre of investment risk. We've identified 1 warning sign with hipages Group Holdings, and understanding this should be part of your investment process.

keywords.name: hipages Group Holdings Full Year 2025 Earnings

summary: The company's shares have risen by 26% since a week ago, with a profit margin of 2.9% and its revenue expected to grow by 9.8% over the next three years. This growth is slower than the 8.0% forecast for the Interactive Media and Services industry in Australia. However, the company remains a cautionary note for investors. The article also mentions 21 US stocks forecast to pay a dividend yield of over 6% next year.
shortSummary: Hipems Group Holdings' full-year earnings report shows signs of declining profit margins due to higher expenses, but expects growth in revenue and dividends.

About the Company
| Founded | Employees | CEO | Website |
|---|---|---|---|
| 2004 | n/a | Roby Sharon-Zipser | hipagesgroup.com.au |
hipages Group Holdings Limited, together with its subsidiaries, operates as an online tradie marketplace in Australia and New Zealand. It provides hipages, an online tradie marketplace that provides local tradies with job leads, grow and manage their business; and Builderscrack, an online home repair and renovation marketplace that enables homeowners to connect with local tradies. The company also provides Tradiecore, a job management solution; and Proptech Labs, a property management productivity software.

argos_summary: Hipages Group Holdings (HPG) reported a 2.9% net profit margin and an EPS of AU$0.018, down from FY 2024 figures, reflecting higher expenses. The company is forecast to grow earnings by 43% and revenue by 9.8% annually over the next three years, with EPS expected to rise 55.8% per year, while its return on equity is projected at 16.2%. HPG’s shares have surged 26% in the past week but have underperformed the Australian Interactive Media and Services industry over the past year. The company’s valuation sits at a PE of 72.4x and a market cap of AU$172.9 m, with a strong financial health score but no dividends. Industry-wide, the Australian Interactive Media and Services sector has seen modest revenue growth of 9.8% per annum and a market cap of AU$60.8 b as of August 2025, with a PE around 51x.
